data.title: This place is too cute!
data.text: Let's be honest what gets you to stop at this place, is based on looks because it looks chic and trendy, I saw postings on IG and I knew I just had to try it. Who doesn't want their drink in an cute bottle. Prices aren't even bad they are similar to what other boba places are charging with out a collector bottles. The drinks are very good so that is a win cute and tasty. They have many options to choose from, a wide range, tea, milk tea, slushies, smoothies, etc. Came here twice my last visit to Socal. Definitely coming back next visit.

data.title: One of my new cravings
data.text:
A friend of mine turned me on to this little diamond in the rough within a small strip mall in Westminster. This place is a technically a boba house, but what I really love about it is that there is such a variety of people that come here, I never feel awkward ordering my drink. Other boba houses I've been too make feel as though I stick out and shouldn't be there, being I'm a "white girl" who likes boba drinks.

Now speaking of their drinks, I'm definitely a tea girl and I love their teas are brewed creations instead of sugary powders mixed into waters. They also include familiar and exotic fruit pieces in their teas and several different additives similar to boba which is super unique and yummy. 

Also I am in LOVE with the cups this place uses. They now switch up styles every week or two and they are either adorable glass jars sealed with a cork, or the new reusable sport containers they've introduced. Either way you get a cute cup and a delicious drink! Go check it out. There is also now a location in garden grove, Chapman and Brookhurst near the Regal Cinemas.

data.title: Roasting Water
data.text:
The name of this establishment, Roasting Water sounds so unique, that upon recommendation of my daughter, who is a fan of this place, intrigued our fancy. It's actually a small joint, with an 8-10 seater capacity inside and 3 outside sitting to converge and have a pep talk with your friends.
A watering hole that serves slushies, milk tea, smoothies, with or without boba pearls and to fulfill your thirst for unique concoction and with some exotic fruits- avocado, pineapple, kiwi, bananas to name a few.
The drink comes in an elongated tube like souvenir bottle with cork which can take home and they're reasonably included in the price.
A must come back place whenever we visit Cali.

Friendly service and nice decors.

data.title: A Trendy Watering Hole
data.text:
Went here with relatives to try this place as friends were raving about it.
Out of curiosity and the craving for boba slushies, we visited this hole in the wall hang around kind of thing.
It was a very small joint where you can meet and coverge to get a boba milk tea in lots of exotic and unique flavors i.e. Pineapple, lychee, and strawberry flavors.
We got the lychee smoothie with boba petals. All drinks were served in a regular medium sized bottle container with a cork. You can take it home as a souvenir. It looks like a potion bottle

data.title: Very good drinks and friendly staff
data.text: Again not sure why there aren't more places like this up north.  This is a nice small very quaint tea shop with cute seating and nice friendly staff and lots of yummy choices of teas, milk teas, smoothies and fruit teas.  Could try everything on menu if I had the time but we got a Cast Away and a passion tea and were very pleased. Cute cups and mugs on the wall for sale complete the decor and I like that it's a small out of the way place glad we found this - thanks to all my Yelper friends who helped put this in my search view while passing through area. Come check them out

data.title: Hipster Hangout
data.text: This was a location that I went with my apartment mates on a impulse trip one night. We wanted some drinks and I had seen a lot of people post Instagram worthy pictures from Roasting Water so we decided to try it out. The business is located where there is a lot of parking so parking isn't an issue but the business itself does not have a lot of sitting room. They have seating for 8-10 people (4-5 tables) and there usually is a line. The drinks are really good and they come at very decent price. I wouldn't say that these drinks are expensive at all. I had the white peach lemonade and it was great. I also go boba with my drink and the boba pearls were perfect. My roommate got the oolong milk tea and she really enjoyed it. Everyone who ordered a drink was completely satisfied with our drinks (we were even joking about going back to get more when we finished our drinks in the parking lot). The drinks come in these cute jars with cork tops so when you finally get your drink, don't forget to snap a picture to show the world. Happy drinking! :)

data.title: ちょっと変わった飲み物だよ
data.text: ベトナム風飲み物のお店。たくさん種類があり、全種類試してみたくなります。持ち帰りがほとんどで、飲み物はかわいいガラスのビンに入れてくれます。一種類の飲み物の中に、果物とか、バジルシードとか、アロエとかいろいろ入っていて、どれも変わっていてしかも美味しいです。お店は小さいながら、可愛らしく装飾してあり、可愛い持ち帰り用のガラスビンで出すというコンセプトがうけて、いつも大賑わいで並んでいます。並んででも、一度は行く価値はあると思います。
